### Prerequisites

- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

I am trying to write a PowerShell script to perform BTRFS snapshot management for Linux. The issue I'm running into is when I attempt to perform a BTRFS send and then pipe that output into a BTRFS receive, like the following:

`btrfs send -p /btrfs/send/snapshot/parent /btrfs/send/snapshot/new | btrfs receive /btrfs/receive/snapshot/`

It does not appear that PowerShell is handling the output correctly from `btrfs send`, because it throws a crc error when attempting to do this.

If I break the command into two separate commands, using a file, my send/receive works just fine (example below). So I know powershell correctly executes the `btrfs send` and `btrfs receive` commands, it's just something about how PowerShell is handling the piping between the commands.
`btrfs send -p $PreviousSnapshot $CurrentSnapshot -f /mnt/nvme/.snapshots/send_snap`
`btrfs receive -f /mnt/nvme/.snapshots/send_snap $DestinationDirectory`


### Expected behavior

```console
btrfs send -p /mnt/nvme/.snapshots/@GMT-2021.09.05-01.53.53/appdata /mnt/nvme/.snapshots/@GMT-2021.09.05-02.04.09/appdata | btrfs receive /mnt/hdd/nvme_snapshots/@GMT-2021.09.05-02.04.09/
At subvol /mnt/nvme/.snapshots/@GMT-2021.09.05-02.04.09/appdata
At snapshot appdata
```


### Actual behavior

```console
btrfs send -p -v /mnt/nvme/.snapshots/@GMT-2021.09.05-01.53.53/appdata /mnt/nvme/.snapshots/@GMT-2021.09.05-02.04.09/appdata | btrfs receive -v /mnt/hdd/nvme_snapshots/@GMT-2021.09.05-02.04.09/
At subvol /mnt/nvme/.snapshots/@GMT-2021.09.05-02.04.09/appdata
ERROR: crc32 mismatch in command
BTRFS_IOC_SEND returned 0
joining genl thread
```
